title: (x) Texter/Konzeptionist - Corporate A {Yves}
content:
Say my name, say my name.. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409004123im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
( Ive seen her before, but i cant remember / find her name.. )   
   
 ![seriftype](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409004123im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/20538.gif)   
( Thank you, fellow Typophiles.. )

 [‹ Fly Emirates Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409004123/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2089 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Latte Intero UHT - Fine Hand, VAG Rounded {Eduardo, Grant} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409004123/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2080 "Go to next forum topic")
author: formlos

comments.content: Looks a bit like Primer/Century 751, a bit squooshed ;) but that's not quite it.

Kurt Weidemann's serif face [Corporate A](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409004123/http:/www.bertholdtypes.com/bq_library/090160000.html) was originally   
designed for [Mercedes-Benz](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409004123/http:/www.mercedes-benz.com/com/e/), together with its sans serif   
and slab serif companions [Corporate S](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409004123/http:/www.bertholdtypes.com/bq_library/090161000.html) and [Corporate E](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409004123/http:/www.bertholdtypes.com/bq_library/090162000.html).   
   
I think we should add _'_

Nice catch, Yves ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409004123im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
Give credit where credit is due, I say. Pity it's too late to edit my post and add the copyright info now ;)

There's a Mercedes garage just up the street: I see   
those faces on a daily basis...
Thank you, Yves, Thank you, Adriano..

Hahahe ... he. Yes, let that be what I add to the world of typography, the word "squooshed".   
   
:\   
   
That'll teach me to use such clever and erudite terminology.   
   
;)

You've started a trend!   
I'll be sure to do a "squooshed" style of my font (whenever I get to work on it) :\>
